text: List of Rulers of the Akan (Bron) state of Akwamu (formerly Twifo-Heman) Territory comprised part of present-day southern Ghana {| border=1 style="border-collapse: collapse" |- align=left ! width="18%"|Tenure ! width="30%"|Incumbent ! width="20%"|Notes |- valign=top |colspan="3"|Akwamuhenes (Rulers) |- valign=top |colspan="3"|Twifo-Heman |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1480 to c.1500||Agyen Kokobo, Akwamuhene||Founder of Twifo-Heman |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1500 to c.1520||Ofusu Kwabi, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1520 to c.1540||Oduro, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1540 to c.1560||Ado, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top |colspan="3"|Akwamu |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1560 to c.1575||Otumfo Asare, Akwamuhene||Founder of the Akwamu State, with capital at Asaremankesse |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1575 to c.1585||Akotia, Akwamuhene||Relocated capital at Ayandawaase |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1585 to c.1600||Ansa Saseraku, Akwamuhene (Ansa Saseraku I)|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1600 to c.1620||Ansa Saseraku, Akwamuhene (Ansa Saseraku II)|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1620 to c.1640||Ansa Saseraku, Akwamuhene (Ansa Saseraku III)|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1640 to c.1660||Abuako Dako, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1660 to c.1680||Afera Kuma, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |c.1680 to 1702||Manukure, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |1702 to 1726||Akwano Panyini, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |1726 to 1734||Dako Booman, Akwamuhene|| |- valign=top |1734||colspan="2"|Conquest by the Akyem peoples |} ==See also== *Akan (ethnic group) *Ghana *Gold Coast *Lists of Incumbents Category:History of Ghana Category:Ghana-related lists Category:Lists of African rulers
title: List of rulers of the Akan states of Akwamu and Twifo-Heman
